page.title: 06Dorchester Bypass
page.content: The A35 (East to West) through Dorchester becomes too congested with tourist and local traffic, especially in the summer months. If nothing is done it will become worse each year as traffic increases. Accidents and noise could be reduced by the construction of a bypass. The{Southern Route}would pass very close to large housing estates and cause a lot of nuisance to the residents, but it would be quicker for Industrial vehicles from Bridport. A local farmer thinks this route would spoil the view from Maiden Castle. The{Northern Route}would only disturb four homes and it would pass across open land. This route would be better for most traffic which comes from the North. The final decision about the route has not yet been made.
